body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->
Since I installed **0.19.0.1** (over 0.18.0.1) the number of transactions of the Mempool and corresponding memory now show both N.D. instead of the real values). This is of course in Information Window / Informations.

**Expected behavior**
Values should be displayed as in previous releases

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->

**Actual behavior**

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18514601/70339764-b2d4e080-184f-11ea-8cf0-81e97f14133b.png)

**To reproduce**

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->
Just open Bitcoin Core, wait for a full synch with the blockchain. Usually the mempool info would then be displayed and updated.

**System information**

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? --> 0.19.0.1

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
Windows 4 cores SSD disk

<!-- GUI-related issue? What is your operating system and its version? If Linux, what is your desktop environment and graphical shell? -->
Windows 10 pro. fully patched. French language / french locale.

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->
<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
All previous version of bitcoin Core were correctly displaying mempool info
title: No mempool data display in 0.19.0.1 (64 bits / Windows)
